messages.content: Tell me about FUTA.
FUTA na Federal University of Technology for Akure. Dem sabi for tech, science, and engineering courses well well.
Where FUTA dey located?
FUTA dey for Akure, Ondo State, Nigeria. If you reach South-West, na there e dey.
How many faculties dey for FUTA?
Omo, na plenty o. We get Engineering, Science, Agriculture, Management Technology, Environmental, Earth & Mineral Sciences, Life Sciences, and Social Sciences too.
How FUTA grading system be?
Na 5-point scale. A=5, B=4, C=3, D=2, E=1, F=0. CGPA na the koko wey determine your class of degree.
How I go calculate my GPA?
Multiply each course unit by the grade point, sum everything, then divide by total units. Simple arithmetic.
Which course FUTA popular for?
Na Engineering and Computer Science be their hot cake. Dem dey rank well for tech research.
When FUTA session dey start?
Normally, session dey start around October, then second semester dey start March.
FUTA get hostel for students?
Yes na. Both male and female hostels dey. But omo, space dey scarce, so sharp sharp application dey needed.
How students dey chop for campus?
Cafeteria full ground. From rice, beans, amala, spaghetti, to snacks. Na the chop life wey dey keep students going.
Which sport FUTA dey good for?
Football and athletics na FUTA pride. But dem dey try for basketball and volleyball too.
FUTA dey join NUGA games?
Yes o! FUTA dey represent well for Nigerian University Games. Dem don win medals for athletics and football.
FUTA get cultural day?
Sure. FUTA Cultural Day na big event wey students dey showcase their tradition, dance, and food.
How FUTA students dey relax?
Apart from reading, dem dey watch football, do music, hang out for Awo Junction, and gist for hostel.
Na which app FUTA dey use for results?
Dem dey use FUTA student portal. You fit log in with your matric number see result, register course, pay fees.
How FUTA exams dey be?
Exams dey serious o. Na hall exams with invigilators. You no go fit run anyhow.
How I fit join FUTA library?
Just register with your student ID. Dem go give you access to books, journals, and e-resources.
FUTA dey support student business?
Yes na. Through CED and innovation hubs. Plenty students dey run tech, agro, and fashion hustle on campus.
FUTA dey do SIWES?
Omo, na compulsory. Student Industrial Work Experience Scheme dey help you gather work experience before graduation.
How FUTA hostel life be?
Hostel life dey fun but rugged. You go meet different people, share gist, but light and water fit stress you small.
FUTA students dey do politics?
Yes. FUTASU na the student union. Dem dey organize elections, campaigns, and represent student matters.
Religious life dey FUTA?
Plenty. Christians get fellowships, Muslims get MSSN. Students dey gather for prayers, Bible study, Quran sessions.
FUTA dey allow night reading?
Yes. Libraries and reading halls dey open for night reading during exam period.
What’s Awo Junction?
Awo Junction na popular spot for FUTA students to chill, buy food, and connect with people.
How FUTA students dey celebrate graduation?
Convocation dey grand. Students dey snap pictures, do thanksgiving, party, and flex with friends.
FUTA dey strict on dressing?
Dem dey encourage decent dressing. No crazy dressings inside lecture halls, but normal campus life still dey free.
FUTA dey do entrepreneurship fair?
Yes. Innovation fair dey yearly where students showcase business ideas, projects, and even secure investors.
FUTA students dey do parties?
Omo, yes. From fresher’s party to faculty dinner nights. Social life dey very alive.
How FUTA fresher’s orientation dey be?
Na week-long event with lectures, campus tour, cultural activities, and social programs to welcome new students.
FUTA dey do tech hackathons?
Yes. FUTA students dey shine for coding competitions and hackathons, sometimes dem even win national prizes.
FUTA alumni dey active?
Very active. Alumni dey provide mentorship, networking, and sometimes fund projects for students.
Where FUTA students dey read pass?
Library, lecture theatres, and love gardens. Night class na tradition too.
FUTA get school anthem?
Yes. Dem dey sing am during official events like matriculation and convocation.
How FUTA transport system be?
Shuttle buses dey carry students around campus. Outside campus, taxis and okada dey available.
Which hangout spot popular in FUTA?
Love Garden and Awo Junction dey popular. Students dey go there to gist, eat, and relax.
FUTA dey celebrate cultural week?
Yes. Cultural week dey showcase Nigeria tribes with food, dressing, and performances.
How FUTA students dey balance academics and social life?
E no easy, but most people dey plan their time well. Weekday na book, weekend na flex.
FUTA dey do inter-hall competition?
Yes. Inter-hall football and debate competition dey. Na chance to show talent and rep your hostel.
FUTA dey provide health services?
Yes. School clinic dey campus. Students fit go for check-up, treatment, and medical test.
Na where FUTA students dey buy foodstuff?
Oja Oba, FUTA North Gate market, and inside campus mini shops dey provide foodstuff for students.
FUTA dey allow student clubs?
Yes. Plenty clubs dey. From drama, debate, tech, music, to religious and volunteer clubs.
How religious programs dey FUTA?
Plenty. Sunday services, Friday Jummat prayers, midweek Bible studies, and Quranic sessions dey steady.
FUTA dey support innovation projects?
Yes. Research centers dey plus grants for innovative student projects in science and tech.
FUTA students dey do fashion?
Yes. Tailoring and fashion design dey hot among students. Some dey even run clothing brands.
Which events dey popular for FUTA?
Matriculation, convocation, cultural day, tech fairs, fresher’s night, dinner parties, and religious crusades.
FUTA dey allow student politics?
Yes. FUTASU dey handle student governance, and elections dey every year.
FUTA dey do talent hunt?
Yes. Talent shows dey showcase music, dance, spoken word, and drama from students.
How FUTA students dey prepare for exams?
Na past questions, group study, night class, and tutorials. Na normal FUTA student lifestyle.
FUTA dey offer scholarships?
Yes. Government, NGOs, and private companies dey give scholarships to brilliant or needy students.
